questions.question: What is a signal?
options: A physical quantity that varies with time or space
questions.explanation: A signal is defined as a physical quantity (like voltage, temperature, or pressure) that varies with one or more independent variables, typically time.

questions.question: Which of the following is a SYSTEM?
questions.explanation: An amplifier is a system because it transforms an input signal (low amplitude) into an output signal (high amplitude). The others are all signals.

questions.question: What does x(t) notation indicate?
questions.explanation: Parentheses x(t) indicate a continuous-time signal, defined for all real values of t. Brackets x[n] would indicate discrete-time.

questions.question: A microphone is best described as:
questions.explanation: A microphone is a transducer ‚Äî a type of system that converts one form of signal (acoustic pressure) to another form (electrical voltage).

questions.question: In the notation y(t) = T{x(t)}, what does T represent?
questions.explanation: T (or ùíØ) represents the system operator that transforms the input signal x(t) into the output signal y(t).

questions.question: Which is an example of a 2D signal?
questions.explanation: A grayscale image I(x,y) is a 2D signal with two independent spatial variables (x and y). Audio and temperature are 1D signals indexed by time.

questions.question: What type of connection feeds the output back to the input?
questions.explanation: In a feedback connection, the output signal is fed back and combined with the input. This is the basis of control systems.

questions.question: Why are electrical signals preferred for processing?
options: They are the only type that exists
They are easy to amplify, filter, and transmit
questions.explanation: Electrical signals are preferred because they are easy to process (amplify, filter), transmit (wires, wireless), and store (digital memory).

questions.question: In a block diagram, what do arrows represent?
questions.explanation: In block diagrams, arrows represent the flow of signals from one system (block) to another.

questions.question: A speaker converts:
questions.explanation: A speaker is a transducer that converts electrical signals (voltage variations) into acoustic signals (sound pressure variations). A microphone does the opposite.
